Isabella Rodriguez.description: working on party preparations for her birthday party at Hobbs Cafe (conversing about highlighting the importance of incorporating traditional African music, spoken word elements, jazz, and hip-hop into their project to authentically represent and amplify the voices and experiences of the Black community, while also addressing systemic inequalities, social injustices, and the impact of gentrification, and emphasizing the need to actively involve, collaborate with, listen to, and educate themselves about the diverse perspectives and intersectionality within the Black community.) @ the Ville:Hobbs Cafe:cafe:piano

Carlos Gomez.description: working on his poetry collection (writing a new poem) @ the Ville:Carlos Gomez's apartment:main room:desk

Klaus Mueller.description: still at the library working on his research paper (conducting literature review) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:library:library table

Sam Moore.description: running errands or catching up on emails (making phone calls to schedule appointments or confirm plans) @ the Ville:Moore family's house:main room:desk

Ayesha Khan.description: researching for her senior thesis at the library (conversing about Ayesha Khan and Wolfgang Schulz are discussing ways to authentically represent the Black community's perspective in their project by incorporating personal narratives, traditional African music, spoken word performances, exploring the impact of gentrification, showcasing resilience, involving local artists, delving into Black history and African folklore, including jazz music, and potentially inviting Eddy Lin to join their collaboration.) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:library:library table
